clinical_study.brief_title: The Effectiveness of Saw Palmetto and Sanmiaoshan on Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia in Chinese Patients
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of Saw Palmetto and Sanmiaoshan on International Prostate Symptom Score and Peak Urinary Flow Rate of Chinese Patients With Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the effect of saw palmetto and sanmiaoshan, on top of alpha blocker, on urinary flow rate and BPH symptoms in patients with BPH.

primary_outcome.measure: Differences in IPSS between the study medication and placebo groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: At study enrolment, after six month of study medication or placebo administration, at the end of washout period and after six month of alternative drug treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Differences in Qmax between the study medication and placebo groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: At study enrolment, after six month of study medication or placebo administration, at the end of washout period and after six month of alternative drug treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Differences in IPSS and Qmax at baseline and at the end of treatment drug / placebo treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study enrolment/ after washout period to the end of study medication / placebo administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean urinary flow rate, post-void residual volume, prostate volume, PSA and GHQ score between study medication group and placebo group
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At study enrolment, after six month of study medication or placebo administration, at the end of washout period and after six month of alternative drug treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean urinary flow rate, post-void residual volume, prostate volume, PSA and GHQ score between study medication group and baseline, and placebo group and baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From study enrolment/ after washout period to the end of study medication / placebo administration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age between 50 and 80 years old
- Clinically diagnosed to have BPH:
- Suffered from lower urinary tract symptoms with IPSS>=8
- Detectable prostatic enlargement determined by DRE
- Urinary flow between 5 and 15ml/second in a total void volume >=150mL
- Serum PSA level less than 4ng/ml or in between 4-10 ng/ml with percent free PSA >25% or>=4 with cancer excluded by biopsy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Acute retention of urine
- Congestive heart failure, unstable angina, arrhythmia, myocardial infraction
- Prostatic surgery
- Prostatic malignancy
- Gastrointestinal disease
- Renal impairment with serum creatinine >140 umol/l
- Hepatic disorder
